[ ] RISK-001 | wp-cron.php DoS Attack               | Priority 8
    □ Added define('DISABLE_WP_CRON', true) to wp-config.php
    □ Server cron job created to replace wp-cron.php
    □ Verified: GET /wp-cron.php returns 403
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-002 | XML-RPC Pingback DDoS                | Priority 9
    □ /xmlrpc.php blocked via .htaccess or nginx deny rule
    □ Verified: POST /xmlrpc.php returns 403
    □ Confirmed legitimate XML-RPC use cases are handled
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-007 | No Rate Limiting on Login            | Priority 9
    □ fail2ban installed and configured with WordPress jail
    □ Nginx limit_req_zone added for /wp-login.php
    □ Lockout triggers after 5 failed attempts within 10 min
    □ Verified: 6th failed login attempt is blocked
    □ Monitoring/alerting configured for lockout events
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-003 | Username Enumeration via REST API    | Priority 6
    □ add_filter('rest_authentication_errors') implemented
    □ Verified: GET /wp-json/wp/v2/users returns 401
    □ Verified: GET /wp-json/wp/v2/users/1 returns 401
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-004 | Email Flooding via Password Reset    | Priority 5
    □ Rate limiting: max 3 resets per 5 min per IP
    □ CAPTCHA added to password reset form
    □ Verified: 6th reset attempt is rate-limited
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-005 | Admin Username via Author Query      | Priority 6
    □ Author query redirect blocked via rewrite rules
    □ Verified: GET /?author=1 returns 403 (not redirect to /author/admin)
    □ Verified: GET /?author=2 also returns 403
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-008 | Username Enumeration via Login       | Priority 5
    □ Login error messages overridden to generic "Invalid credentials"
    □ Verified: invalid username gives same error as wrong password
    □ No "unknown username" or "incorrect password" text in response
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-009 | No Rate Limiting on Contact Forms    | Priority 4
    □ Rate limiting added: max 5 submissions per minute per IP
    □ reCAPTCHA v3 or hCaptcha added to all public forms
    □ Verified: 11th rapid submission is blocked/challenged
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-011 | WordPress Version via readme.html    | Priority 4
    □ /readme.html blocked or deleted
    □ /license.txt blocked or deleted
    □ /wp-activate.php blocked
    □ Verified: GET /readme.html returns 403 or 404
    Notes: ________________________________________________

[ ] RISK-012 | HSTS Not Implemented                 | Priority 6
    □ Strict-Transport-Security header added to server config
    □ max-age set to at least 31536000 (1 year)
    □ includeSubDomains added (after verifying all subdomains use HTTPS)
    □ HTTP requests redirect to HTTPS (301/302)
    □ Verified: curl -sI https://site.com | grep strict-transport
    □ Consider: submitted to hstspreload.org
    Notes: ________________________________________________
